data.title: Very moving Exhibit
data.text:
Searched all of downtown for all the cultural aspects of this pivotal city in our country's history. Found this one to be very moving especially after visiting the State Capital Building
Please take time to bear witness of how a nation can be historically so unwilling to grant freedom after fighting so hard to attain it. We must remember how we felt when oppressed by King George and work to guarantee that right to the very people we oppressed. signed one very proud American :}:}

data.title: Lovely
data.text: The State House was along my route from workshop site to hotel, so I took the opportunity to explore the grounds, whereupon I found this lovely bronze relief in timeline form. Sad, lovely, historical, and inspiring all in one. Glad I happened upon it.

data.title: Beautiful History Monument
data.text: The State House grounds are beautiful and this monument is a lovely part of the tour. The monument captures several hundred years of history in a powerful and moving way. It is worth a visit while in Columbia.

data.title: Great history timeline and story!
data.text: This is one of my favorite monuments.  It tells a story.  It starts  out with the depiction of how the slaves were brought over in the bottoms of the ships and takes you through time to modern day in South Carolina. The monument celebrates the contributions of African-Americans as well as notable African-Americans from South Carolina.

data.title: Impressive
data.text: Excellently designed to showcase African American history across centuries.  Well-sculpted to be both interesting and educational.  Worthwhile for young and old.  I visited late at night and found it a very moving experience.  Quite impressed with this being on the statehouse grounds.

data.title: Impressive
data.text:
Worth a trip to the State Capital to see this monument.  It depicts slavery to current day. Interesting sculpture that both explicitly and  subtly illustrates fact and emotions.

Combine with a walk through the building with beautiful architecture and a stroll through park like grounds to spend anywhere from 30 minutes to a couple of hours.

Highly recommended.

data.title: It was the last place I visited but the best
data.text: I will always remember this place.  I don't get a chance to visit many museums and I don't know if I've ever been to a Black History Museum, but this should be on the list for school trips instead of the zoo.  The zoo can't give you the knowledge this place does.  I thank you all again for a wonderful experience.

data.title: Ordinary Monument
data.text: Ok so this is not something that you need to make a special trip for all by it's self. If your going to the capital than check it out, if your walking around down town maybe stop by, but there is no need to make a special trip just for this monument. It is a nice monument that shows part of American history, but than again so did the confederate flag in front of the capital which was removed. This is not a separate monument but more part of the grounds of the capital where there are a dozen other memorials and monuments also that should be seen and preserved. All equally worth the trip and once your here stop by and tour the capital since it is right there. I had my family here several times walking the grounds and each time we find new ways to get memories captured through a picture.

data.title: Beautifully designed and appropriately situated
data.text: The African American History Monument has both of the most important attributes a monument can have -- excellent design and appropriate location.  It is one of the best black history monuments that I have ever seen, and certainly the best in the state of South Carolina. Perhaps even more importantly, it is situated in a place of great honor; on the beautifully landscaped grounds of the South Carolina Statehouse, right next to the Statehouse itself.  When you visit the South Carolina Statehouse, be sure to have a good look at this monument.

data.title: A Great Reason to Visit the Capital
data.text: In addition to the state House, you need to visit this one of many informative monuments. This state house complex rivals Boston for historical significance!

data.title: Good Peice of History
data.text: I took my daughter to the State House and this monument was on the side of the building outside. I don't know why it has it's own label on here when it is just another monument on the state house grounds. if visiting the State House than encourage to check it out, but would not make a seperate trip for a finve minute look. There are dozens of monuments and statues all over the state house grounds to enjoy in an afternoon walk around Columbia.

data.title: Nice monument
data.text: Located on the State House grounds. A nice tribute to the past history of this state. Good to stand, ponder and read. worth checking out if in the downtown area.

data.title: In the shadow of pain!
data.text:
The African American History Monument sits within touching distance of the very centre of their pain and strife, for it was in the State House only yards away that voted to continue to take away the liberties of the people honoured by this memorial.

Although not a monument on the grand scale of Washington DC it is however a very poignant reminder of the treatment received by the innocent African slaves in the 1800's and a few minutes of your time could be well spent just taking in the striking carvings around the base of the monument and what they stand for in this modern world?

At the front of the monument set in the paving is view of a slave ship showing the configuration of the quarters surrounded by a low steel fence which represents captivity.

Not a long visit but very thought provoking?

data.title: Bonito monumento
data.text: É um bonito monumento que retrata um pedaço da história dos Estados Unidos. Vários pontos turísticos ficam próximos ao monumento.

user_location.name: State of Rio Grande do Sul

data.title: Grande monumento
data.text: Grande monumento, que representa uma parte da história americana. Detalhado e bem conservado, está próximo a State House.
